qas.question: Who became president of the Congo in 1968?
What did the Congo's name become under Ngouabi?
What did the National Revolutionary Movement's name become?
In what year was a coup attempted against Ngouabi?
On what date was Ngouabi assassinated?
Who left the presidency on December 31, 1968?
Who became president after Denis Sassou Nguesso?
What did the Congo's name change to under Denis Sassou Nguesso?
When did Denis Sassou Nguesso survive a coup?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>Marien Ngouabi<b5_0/><a0_0/>, who had participated in the coup, assumed the presidency on December 31, 1968. One year later, President Ngouabi proclaimed Congo Africa's first "people's republic", the <a1_0><b7_0>People's Republic of the Congo<b7_0/><a1_0/>, and announced the decision of the National Revolutionary Movement to change its name to the <a2_0>Congolese Labour Party<a2_0/> (PCT). Ngouabi survived an attempted coup in <a3_0><b8_0>1972<b8_0/><a3_0/> but was assassinated on <a4_0><b9_0>March 16, 1977<b9_0/><a4_0/>. An 11-member Military Committee of the Party (CMP) was then named to head an interim government with <b6_0>Joachim Yhombi-Opango<b6_0/> to serve as President of the Republic. Two years later, Yhombi-Opango was forced from power and Denis Sassou Nguesso become the new president.
